(Cairo) and Saving to Angora and Moscow. Iraqi Ministry of the Interior are receiving numbers of reports indicating that Mullah Mustafa who is said to be at Maku on Persian-Soviet frontier is sending unit into Persia to stir up the tribes preparatory to an armed descent into Iraqi Kurdistan. 2. Our information indicates that there is no substance in these reports, but the Minister of the Interior and Director-General of the . Police believe them to be true* I should be grateful for any information which you have or can obtain.■ [This telegram is of particular secrecy^ai|d sho^|d[&e retained by the authorised recipient ana not passedf onj Gyphe r/OTP DIP LGi^-JIO_DI^iflDWJTIO^. I have received a note from the Iraqi Government which ctitpq that the Treat Government have instructed tneir representatives at Angora and Tehran to ask the Government to vniich they are accredited to furnish tnem periodico.lly nth any information they may obtain about movements and intentions of Mulla Mustafa and his Bar[gp. uMec.Ji followers (who are now in the Soviet bmon) und about a: y other movements in Turkey or Persia which might affe security in Iraqi Kurdistan. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 7039/49 'Concerning the movements of Mullah Mustafa'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 7; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: The file contains two reports from the British Embassy, Baghdad, concerning attempts by the Government of Iraq to obtain information about the movements of Mustafa Barzani, leader of the Kurdistan Democratic Party. The file includes a divider, which gives a list of correspondence references contained in the file by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
